canonical_explanation.text: Our body has many parts that help us do different things. We have eyes to see, ears to hear, nose to smell, tongue to taste, and skin to feel. These are our five senses. We must take care of our body by keeping it clean.
rules: Our body has many parts like head, hands, legs, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.
We have five senses: seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching.
Eyes help us see, ears help us hear, nose helps us smell.
Tongue helps us taste, skin helps us feel things.
We must keep our body clean by washing, brushing, and bathing.

questions.question_text: Which body part do we use to see?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our eyes to see. Our eyes help us look at and understand the world around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use our ears, nose, or mouth to see. These body parts are used for hearing, smelling, and tasting, not seeing. Our eyes are the part of our body that we use to see things.

questions.question_text: Which body part do we use to hear sounds?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our ears to hear sounds. Our ears are the body part that allow us to listen and understand the different sounds around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The eyes are used to see, the nose is used to smell, and the tongue is used to taste. But the ears are the body part that we use to hear different sounds. The ears have special parts that help us listen to things like people talking, music, and other noises.

questions.question_text: How many senses do we have?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 5 senses - sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch. This makes the correct answer 5 senses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 5 senses. We have eyes to see, ears to hear, nose to smell, tongue to taste, and skin to feel. These are our 5 senses that help us understand the world around us. Options A, B, and D are incorrect because we have more than 3, 4, or 6 senses.

questions.question_text: Which body part helps us smell flowers?
questions.explanation_correct: Our nose helps us smell flowers and other things. We use our nose to take in the smell of flowers, food, and many other things around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The eyes help us see, the ears help us hear, and the hands help us feel things. But the nose is the part of our body that helps us smell flowers and other things. The nose has special parts inside that allow us to smell different smells.

questions.question_text: Which body part helps us taste food?
questions.explanation_correct: The tongue helps us taste food. We use our tongue to feel the different flavors of the food we eat, like sweet, sour, salty, or bitter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nose is used for smelling, the ears are used for hearing, and the eyes are used for seeing. But the tongue is the body part that helps us taste the food we eat. The tongue has special parts that can detect the different flavors of food.

questions.question_text: What do we use our legs for?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our legs to walk and run. Our legs have muscles and bones that help us move around and do fun activities like playing games.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We don't use our legs to see, hear, or smell. Our legs are for walking and running. They have special muscles and bones that help us move our body and go places.

questions.question_text: What do we use our hands for?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our hands to hold things. Our hands are very useful for picking up and carrying objects. We can use our hands to do many activities like writing, eating, playing, and more.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use our hands to walk. We use our legs and feet to walk and move around. We also do not use our hands to hear or smell. Our ears are used to hear, and our nose is used to smell.

questions.question_text: Which sense do we use to feel if something is hot or cold?
questions.explanation_correct: We use our sense of touch, or our skin, to feel if something is hot or cold. Our skin helps us feel the temperature of things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use our sight, hearing, or smell to feel if something is hot or cold. We use our sense of touch, which is our skin, to feel the temperature of things. Our skin can tell us if something is hot, cold, or somewhere in between.

questions.question_text: How many eyes do we have?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 2 eyes because that is the normal number of eyes for humans. Our eyes help us see the world around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have 1, 3, or 4 eyes. Humans have 2 eyes to help us see things clearly. Having more or fewer eyes would make it harder for us to see properly.

questions.question_text: How many ears do we have?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 2 ears, one on each side of our head. This helps us hear sounds from all directions around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not have 1, 3, or 4 ears. We have 2 ears, one on the left side and one on the right side of our head. This allows us to hear sounds from all around us.

questions.question_text: What should we do to keep our teeth clean?
questions.explanation_correct: We should brush our teeth with toothpaste to keep them clean. Toothpaste helps remove the dirt and germs from our teeth, keeping them healthy and strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not just wash our teeth with water, as that will not clean them properly. Eating more sweets is also not a good idea, as that can actually make our teeth more dirty and unhealthy. The best way to keep our teeth clean is to brush them with toothpaste every day.

questions.question_text: How often should we take a bath?
questions.explanation_correct: We should take a bath every day because it helps keep our body clean and healthy. Bathing every day removes dirt, germs, and sweat from our skin so we stay fresh and prevent illnesses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taking a bath once a week or once a month is not enough to keep our body clean. Our skin can get dirty and germy if we don't bathe every day. Skipping baths completely is also not a good idea, as it can make us sick. The right answer is to take a bath every day to stay healthy and fresh.

questions.question_text: Ria closed her eyes. Which sense can she NOT use now?
questions.explanation_correct: When Ria closed her eyes, she cannot use her sense of sight. Sight is the ability to see, and it requires the eyes to be open.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) Sight. Ria cannot use her sense of sight because she has closed her eyes. The other senses, such as hearing, smell, and touch, can still be used even with eyes closed.

questions.question_text: You want to know if your food is too hot. Which sense will you use?
questions.explanation_correct: You will use your sense of touch to know if your food is too hot. Our skin and hands can feel the temperature of things, so we use the sense of touch to check if the food is too hot to eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You will not use your sight, hearing, or smell to know if your food is too hot. These senses are for seeing, hearing, and smelling, not for checking the temperature of things. The correct sense to use is touch, because your skin and hands can feel the temperature and tell you if the food is too hot.

questions.question_text: Which sense helps you know that a rose smells nice?
questions.explanation_correct: The sense of smell helps you know that a rose smells nice. Our nose is the organ that allows us to smell different things, like the nice smell of a rose.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sight, taste, and hearing are not the senses that help you know a rose smells nice. The sense of smell, using our nose, is what allows us to smell different scents and know that a rose has a nice smell.

questions.question_text: To kick a ball, which body part do you use?
questions.explanation_correct: To kick a ball, we use our legs. Our legs are the body part that helps us move around and kick things like a ball.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use our hands to kick a ball. Our hands are for holding and grabbing things. We also do not use our head or ears to kick a ball. The correct body part to use is our legs, which are strong and help us kick the ball.

questions.question_text: To clap, which body part do you use?
questions.explanation_correct: You use your hands to clap. Our hands are the best body part for clapping because they can come together and make a loud noise.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You do not use your legs, nose, or mouth to clap. Your legs are for walking and running, your nose is for smelling, and your mouth is for talking and eating. Only your hands can come together to make a clapping sound.

questions.question_text: Which sense tells you that music is playing?
questions.explanation_correct: Hearing is the sense that tells you that music is playing. Our ears help us hear the sounds of music, so we use our sense of hearing to know that music is playing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sight (A) is used to see things, not to hear them. Taste (C) is used to taste food, not to hear music. Touch (D) is used to feel things, not to hear them. The sense that tells you that music is playing is hearing (B), because our ears help us hear the sounds of music.

questions.question_text: Which body part is on top of our body?
questions.explanation_correct: The head is on top of our body. Our head has our eyes, ears, nose, and mouth, which are our five senses. The head helps us see, hear, smell, taste, and feel things around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The head is on top of our body, not the legs, hands, or stomach. Our head has our important senses like eyes, ears, nose, and mouth. We use our head to see, hear, smell, taste, and feel things. The head is the most important part on top of our body.

questions.question_text: How many fingers do we have on one hand?
questions.explanation_correct: We have 5 fingers on one hand. This is because our hands are divided into 5 separate digits called fingers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 5 fingers on one hand. While it's true that we have 3, 4, or 6 fingers in total on both hands, each individual hand has 5 fingers. The option for 3, 4, or 6 fingers does not match the number of fingers on a single hand.

questions.question_text: When should we wash our hands?
questions.explanation_correct: We should wash our hands before eating food because our hands can have germs and dirt on them. Washing our hands with soap and water before eating helps keep us healthy and clean.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not wait until only at night or only on Sunday to wash our hands. We should wash our hands before eating food, so that we can remove any germs or dirt that might be on our hands and not get sick from eating with dirty hands.

questions.question_text: Which sense tells you that a mango is sweet?
questions.explanation_correct: The sense of taste tells you that a mango is sweet. Your tongue has tiny bumps called taste buds that can detect different tastes like sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. When you put a mango in your mouth, your taste buds can tell that it is sweet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sense of smell cannot tell you that a mango is sweet. The sense of smell helps you detect different scents, but it does not give you information about the taste of a food. The senses of touch and hearing also cannot tell you that a mango is sweet. Only the sense of taste, using your tongue, can detect the sweetness of a mango.

questions.question_text: Which body part helps us feel if a toy is soft or hard?
questions.explanation_correct: Our skin helps us feel if a toy is soft or hard. We use our skin to touch and feel different objects around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The eyes are used to see, the ears are used to hear, and the nose is used to smell. None of these body parts are used to feel if a toy is soft or hard. The correct body part that helps us feel is our skin. We use our skin to touch and feel different objects around us.

questions.question_text: Where is the nose on our face?

options.text: On the sides of the face

questions.explanation_correct: The nose is located between the eyes and the mouth on our face. This is the right place for the nose to help us smell things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nose is not above the eyes, below the mouth, or on the sides of the face. It is located in the center of our face, between the eyes and the mouth. This is the correct position for the nose to work properly.

questions.question_text: To wave goodbye, which body part do you use?
questions.explanation_correct: To wave goodbye, you use your hand. Waving with your hand is how we say goodbye to someone who is leaving.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You do not use your legs, ears, or nose to wave goodbye. We use our hands to wave and say goodbye to people. Waving with your hand is the right way to show you are saying goodbye.

questions.question_text: What should we do to keep our hair neat?
questions.explanation_correct: We should comb our hair to keep it neat and tidy. Combing helps to smooth down our hair and make it look nice.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not never touch our hair, as that will make it look messy and unkempt. We also should not put water only, as that will not help to style our hair. And we should not cut our hair every day, as that would be too much and make our hair too short.

questions.question_text: Why should we keep our nails short?
questions.explanation_correct: We should keep our nails short because it helps keep germs away. Shorter nails are less likely to collect dirt and bacteria, which can make us sick. Keeping our nails clean and short is important for our health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping our nails short is not just to look pretty or because everyone does it. It's important to keep them short to prevent germs from building up under the nails, which can make us sick. Longer nails can collect more dirt and bacteria, so it's best to keep them trimmed short.

questions.question_text: Which body part is used for eating?
questions.explanation_correct: The mouth is used for eating because it has the tongue and teeth that help us chew and swallow our food. The mouth is the right body part for eating.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The eyes are used for seeing, the ears are used for hearing, and the nose is used for smelling. The correct body part for eating is the mouth, which has the tongue and teeth to help us chew and swallow our food.

questions.question_text: To nod yes, which body part do you move?
questions.explanation_correct: To nod yes, you move your head up and down. Your head is the part of your body that you move to show that you agree or understand something.
questions.explanation_incorrect: To nod yes, you don't move your hands, legs, or fingers. You move your head up and down to show that you agree or understand something. Your head, not your hands, legs, or fingers, is the part of your body that you move to nod yes.

questions.question_text: Which sense do you use to read a book?
questions.explanation_correct: To read a book, you use your eyes to see the words and pictures. Reading is part of your sense of sight, which is one of the five senses our body has.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You do not use your hearing, smell, or taste to read a book. Those senses are for hearing, smelling, and tasting things. Reading is done with your eyes, which is your sense of sight. So the correct answer is option A, sight.

questions.question_text: We have two eyes.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we have two eyes. Our eyes are important for us to see the world around us. We use our two eyes to look at different things and see them clearly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that is not correct. We have two eyes, not one. Having two eyes helps us see better and understand the world around us. Each of our eyes works together to give us a clear picture of what we are looking at.

questions.question_text: We have three ears.
questions.explanation_correct: We have two ears, one on each side of our head. We do not have three ears.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not true that we have three ears. Our body has two ears, one on the left side and one on the right side of our head. We use our ears to hear different sounds around us.

questions.question_text: We use our eyes to see things.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we use our eyes to see things around us. Our eyes are one of our five senses that help us experience the world. We can see colors, shapes, and movements with our eyes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, we do not use our ears to see things. Our eyes are the ones that help us see. We use our ears to hear sounds, our nose to smell, our tongue to taste, and our skin to feel different textures. The eyes are the ones that allow us to see and observe the world around us.

questions.question_text: We use our ears to smell.
questions.explanation_correct: We use our ears to hear, not to smell. Our nose is the part of our body that helps us smell different things around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We use our nose to smell, not our ears. Our ears are for hearing sounds, not for smelling. If we try to use our ears to smell, we won't be able to smell anything because the ears are not made for that purpose.

questions.question_text: The tongue helps us taste food.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the tongue helps us taste food. Our tongue has special taste buds that can detect different tastes like sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. This is how we can enjoy the different flavors of the food we eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, the tongue does not just help us feel food. The tongue has special taste buds that can detect different tastes like sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. This is how we can enjoy the different flavors of the food we eat.

questions.question_text: We should brush our teeth every day.
questions.explanation_correct: It is important to brush our teeth every day to keep them clean and healthy. Brushing helps remove food and germs that can cause cavities and make our teeth and gums hurt.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not true that we should not brush our teeth every day. Brushing our teeth helps keep them clean and prevent problems like cavities. We should brush our teeth at least twice a day, once in the morning and once before going to bed.

questions.question_text: We should never wash our hands.
questions.explanation_correct: We should always wash our hands to keep our body clean and healthy. Washing our hands with soap and water helps remove germs that can make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is important to wash our hands regularly, especially before eating and after using the bathroom. Washing our hands helps to remove dirt, bacteria, and other germs that can make us ill. We should never skip washing our hands, as it is an important way to take care of our body.

questions.question_text: We use our legs to walk.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we use our legs to walk. Our legs are strong and help us move around and go places.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that's not correct. We use our legs to walk, not our hands or arms. Our legs are the part of our body that helps us move and take steps to go from one place to another.

questions.question_text: We use our ears to hold things.
questions.explanation_correct: We use our ears to hear, not to hold things. Our ears are not meant for holding objects, they are part of our sense of hearing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use our ears to hold things. Our ears are located on the sides of our head and are used to hear sounds, not to hold or carry objects. The correct function of our ears is to help us listen and understand the world around us.

questions.question_text: Skin helps us feel if something is hot or cold.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the skin helps us feel if something is hot or cold. Our skin has special cells that can sense temperature, so we can feel when something is hot or cold.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, the skin does not help us feel if something is hot or cold. This is incorrect because our skin has special cells that can sense temperature, which is how we know if something is hot or cold. The skin is an important part of our body that helps us feel different things.

questions.question_text: We use our ___ to see.
questions.explanation_correct: We use our eyes to see because our eyes help us look at things around us. Our eyes have special parts that allow us to see colors, shapes, and movement.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'eyes'. We use our eyes to see, not our ears, nose, tongue, or skin. Our eyes have special parts that help us see the world around us.

questions.question_text: We use our ___ to hear.
questions.explanation_correct: We use our ears to hear because our ears have special parts that can detect sounds and send the information to our brain. Our ears help us hear all the different sounds around us, like music, people talking, and animals making noises.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'ears'. We use our ears to hear because our ears have special parts that can detect sounds. The other parts of our body, like our eyes, nose, tongue, and skin, are used for our other senses of seeing, smelling, tasting, and feeling.

questions.question_text: We use our ___ to smell.
questions.explanation_correct: We use our nose to smell because the nose has special parts inside that can detect different smells. This is one of our five senses that help us experience the world around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'nose'. We do not use our eyes, ears, tongue, or skin to smell. The nose is the part of the body that is specially designed to detect different smells in the air.

questions.question_text: We have ___ senses.
questions.explanation_correct: We have five senses because our body has five main parts that help us experience the world around us - our eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and skin. These five senses allow us to see, hear, smell, taste, and feel different things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'five' senses. We have five main senses in our body - sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch. These five senses are what allow us to experience the world around us. If the answer was not 'five', it would be incorrect because we do not have a different number of senses.

questions.question_text: The ___ helps us taste food.
questions.explanation_correct: The tongue helps us taste food because it has special taste buds that can detect different flavors like sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. The tongue sends this information to our brain so we can enjoy the taste of our food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nose does not help us taste food. The correct answer is the tongue. The tongue has special taste buds that can detect different flavors in the food we eat. It sends this information to our brain so we can taste and enjoy our food.

questions.question_text: Our ___ helps us feel things.
questions.explanation_correct: Our skin helps us feel things. We use our skin to touch and feel different objects and textures around us. The skin on our hands, arms, and other parts of our body is what allows us to feel if something is soft, rough, hot, or cold.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'skin'. Our skin is the part of our body that helps us feel and touch things. We don't use our eyes, ears, nose, or tongue to feel things - we use our skin. The skin covers our whole body and has special nerve endings that allow us to feel different textures and sensations.

questions.question_text: We use our ___ to walk.
questions.explanation_correct: We use our legs to walk. Our legs have muscles that help us move and take steps. Without our legs, we would not be able to walk or move around.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'legs'. We use our legs to walk and move around. Our legs have bones and muscles that allow us to take steps and move from one place to another. Other body parts like our arms or head do not help us walk.

questions.question_text: We use our ___ to hold things.
questions.explanation_correct: We use our hands to hold things. Our hands have fingers, palms, and thumbs that help us grip and carry objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'hands'. We use our hands to hold things, not our eyes, ears, nose, or tongue. Our hands have fingers and palms that allow us to grasp and carry objects.

questions.question_text: We should ___ our teeth every day.
questions.explanation_correct: We should brush our teeth every day to keep them clean and healthy. Brushing helps remove the food particles and germs that can cause cavities and tooth decay.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not clean our teeth. Instead, we should wash our face every day. Washing our face is important to keep our skin clean, but it does not help keep our teeth healthy. To take care of our teeth, we need to brush them regularly.

questions.question_text: We have ___ fingers on each hand.
questions.explanation_correct: We have five fingers on each hand. This is because our hands are designed with five separate fingers that help us hold and grab things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'five'. We have five fingers on each hand, not four or six. Each of our hands has a thumb, index finger, middle finger, ring finger, and little finger, which adds up to five fingers.

questions.question_text: We should wash our ___ before eating.
questions.explanation_correct: We should wash our hands before eating because our hands can have germs and dirt that can make us sick if we eat with them. Washing our hands helps keep our body clean and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not wash our feet before eating. Our feet are far away from our mouth, and we do not use our feet to hold or touch our food. The correct answer is that we should wash our hands before eating, because our hands can pick up germs and dirt that we do not want to put into our body when we are eating.

questions.question_text: The ___ is on top of our body.
questions.explanation_correct: The head is on top of our body. It has our eyes, ears, nose, and mouth which are our five senses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The neck is not the correct answer. The neck is below the head, not on top of the body. The correct answer is 'head' because the head is the top part of our body that has our eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.

questions.question_text: Put these body parts in order from top to bottom of the body.
questions.explanation_correct: The order from top to bottom of the body is head, stomach, and then feet. This is because the head is at the top of the body, the stomach is in the middle, and the feet are at the bottom of the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order from top to bottom should be head, stomach, and then feet. The head is at the very top of the body, the stomach is in the middle, and the feet are at the bottom of the body. The correct order is not stomach, head, and then feet.

questions.question_text: Put these in order: What do we do in the morning?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Wake up, Brush teeth, Take bath because this is the usual order we follow in the morning. First, we wake up from our sleep, then we brush our teeth to keep them clean, and finally we take a bath to clean our whole body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Brush teeth, Wake up, Take bath. This is wrong because we need to wake up first before we can brush our teeth. And we need to brush our teeth before taking a bath, so that we can clean our mouth properly.

questions.question_text: Put the parts of the face in order from top to bottom.
questions.explanation_correct: The eyes are at the top of the face, the nose is in the middle, and the mouth is at the bottom. This is the correct order from top to bottom of the parts of the face.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The eyes, nose, and mouth are not in the correct order. The eyes should be at the top, followed by the nose in the middle, and then the mouth at the bottom. This is the right way to arrange the parts of the face from top to bottom.

questions.question_text: Put in order: How do we wash hands?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Wet hands', 'Use soap', 'Rinse with water'. We need to wet our hands first, then use soap to clean them, and finally rinse the soap off with water. This helps remove germs and keep our hands clean.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be 'Use soap', 'Wet hands', 'Rinse with water'. This is not correct because we need to wet our hands first before using soap, and then rinse the soap off with water. The correct order is important to make sure our hands are fully cleaned.

questions.question_text: Put these in order from smallest to biggest.
questions.explanation_correct: The order from smallest to biggest is Finger, Hand, Arm. A finger is the smallest part of our hand, and the hand is smaller than the whole arm. So this is the right order from smallest to biggest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order should be Finger, Hand, Arm. A finger is the smallest part of our body, then the hand is bigger than the finger, and the arm is the biggest of the three. Arranging them in this order, from smallest to biggest, is the correct way.

questions.question_text: How are our eyes different from our ears?

options.text: Eyes help us see, ears help us hear
Eyes help us hear, ears help us see

questions.explanation_correct: Our eyes and ears do different jobs. Eyes help us see things like colours and shapes, while ears help us hear sounds like music and people talking. They are different body parts with different jobs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes do not help us hear and ears do not help us see. Eyes are for seeing and ears are for hearing. They are not for smelling or tasting either. Each body part has its own special job.

questions.question_text: How does the sense of smell differ from the sense of taste?

options.text: Smell uses the nose, taste uses the tongue
Smell uses the tongue, taste uses the nose

questions.explanation_correct: The sense of smell uses our nose and the sense of taste uses our tongue. When we smell a flower, our nose does the work. When we eat food, our tongue tells us the taste. They use different body parts.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smell does not use the tongue and taste does not use the nose. The nose is for smelling and the tongue is for tasting. Neither smell nor taste uses the eyes or ears. Each sense has its own special body part.

questions.question_text: How are our hands different from our legs?

options.text: Hands are for smelling, legs are for tasting
Hands hold things, legs help us walk
Both are used only for walking
Both are used only for holding

questions.explanation_correct: Our hands and legs do different things. Hands help us hold, grab, and carry things. Legs help us walk, run, and jump. They each have their own important job.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hands are not for smelling and legs are not for tasting. Hands are for holding and grabbing things, while legs are for walking and running. They do not do the same job.

questions.question_text: How does the sense of touch differ from the sense of sight?

options.text: Touch tells us hot or cold, sight tells us colours
Touch tells us colours, sight tells us hot or cold

questions.explanation_correct: The sense of touch uses our skin to feel if things are hot, cold, soft, or hard. The sense of sight uses our eyes to see colours, shapes, and things around us. They give us different kinds of information.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Touch does not tell us colours and sight does not tell us if things are hot or cold. Touch uses skin to feel temperature and texture, while sight uses eyes to see. Neither of them tells us sounds or taste.

questions.question_text: How does the nose differ from the tongue in what they do?

options.text: The nose helps us smell, the tongue helps us taste
The nose helps us taste, the tongue helps us smell

questions.explanation_correct: The nose and tongue have different jobs. The nose helps us smell things like flowers and food. The tongue helps us taste things like sweet mangoes and salty chips. They are both on our face but do different work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nose is not for tasting and the tongue is not for smelling. The nose smells things in the air and the tongue tastes food in our mouth. They do not help us hear or see.

questions.question_text: I can tell you if a bell is ringing. I can tell you if a bird is singing. Which sense am I?
questions.explanation_correct: Hearing is the sense that helps us know when a bell rings or a bird sings. Our ears pick up sounds, so hearing is the right answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sight is for seeing, touch is for feeling, and smell is for smelling. None of these tell us about ringing bells or singing birds. Only our sense of hearing, using our ears, can tell us about sounds.

questions.question_text: I can tell if a blanket is soft. I can tell if water is warm. Which sense am I?
questions.explanation_correct: The sense of touch helps us feel if a blanket is soft and if water is warm. Our skin can feel texture and temperature, so touch is the right answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taste is for tasting food, smell is for smelling things, and sight is for seeing. Only the sense of touch, using our skin, can tell us if something is soft or warm.

questions.question_text: Writing, drawing, and clapping are all done using which body part?
questions.explanation_correct: Writing, drawing, and clapping are all things we do with our hands. Our hands have fingers that help us hold a pencil to write and draw, and we bring our hands together to clap.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use our legs, eyes, or ears for writing, drawing, or clapping. All three activities need our hands. Our hands are very useful for holding things and doing many different actions.

questions.question_text: I can tell if a lemon is sour and if sugar is sweet. Which sense am I?
questions.explanation_correct: The sense of taste helps us know if a lemon is sour and if sugar is sweet. Our tongue has taste buds that can feel different flavours like sweet, sour, salty, and bitter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smell, hearing, and sight cannot tell us if something is sour or sweet. Only the sense of taste, using our tongue, can tell us the flavour of food. Our tongue is the body part made for tasting.

questions.question_text: Riya is in the kitchen. She cannot see the stove, but she knows her mother is cooking. She can smell something yummy. Which sense helped Riya?
questions.explanation_correct: Riya used her sense of smell. Even though she could not see the stove, her nose picked up the yummy smell of cooking food. The sense of smell uses our nose to detect smells in the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Riya could not see the stove, so she did not use sight. The story says she could smell something yummy, not that she heard or touched anything. Her nose helped her know food was being cooked.

questions.question_text: Amit is playing in the school playground. He wants to kick the football to his friend. Which body part should Amit use to kick the ball?
questions.explanation_correct: Amit should use his legs to kick the football. Our legs and feet are the body parts we use for kicking. Legs are strong and can push the ball to his friend.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Amit should not use his hands, head, or ears to kick a football. Kicking is done with our legs and feet. Our legs are made for moving, running, and kicking.

questions.question_text: Priya was playing in the mud at home. Her hands are very dirty. She wants to eat her roti now. What should Priya do first?

options.text: Wash her hands with soap and water
Ask someone else to feed her

questions.explanation_correct: Priya should wash her hands with soap and water before eating. Her hands have mud and germs on them. Washing with soap removes the dirt and germs so she can eat safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Priya should not eat with dirty hands because germs can go into her body and make her sick. Wiping hands on clothes does not clean them properly. She needs to wash her hands with soap and water to remove the mud and germs before eating.

questions.question_text: Rohan is sitting in his room at night. The lights go off suddenly. He cannot see anything, but he hears his mother calling him. Which sense is Rohan using?
questions.explanation_correct: Rohan is using his sense of hearing. The lights are off so he cannot see, but his ears can still hear his mother calling. Hearing works even in the dark because our ears do not need light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rohan cannot use sight because the lights are off and he cannot see. He is not tasting or smelling anything. He hears his mother calling, so he is using his sense of hearing with his ears.

questions.question_text: Meera picks up a glass of milk at home. The glass feels very hot. Which sense told Meera the glass is hot?
questions.explanation_correct: Meera used her sense of touch. When she picked up the glass, her skin on her hands could feel that it was hot. Our skin helps us feel temperature like hot and cold.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Meera did not use sight, taste, or hearing to know the glass was hot. She felt the heat with her hands when she picked up the glass. The sense of touch uses our skin to feel temperature.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT one of our five senses?
questions.explanation_correct: Flying is NOT one of our five senses. Our five senses are sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch. Flying is something birds do, not a sense that our body has.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sight, hearing, and smell are all real senses. Our five senses are sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch. Flying is not a sense at all. It is something that birds and aeroplanes do, not something our body can sense.

questions.question_text: Which of these body parts is NOT found on our face?
questions.explanation_correct: The knee is NOT on our face. The knee is on our leg. Our face has eyes, nose, mouth, and ears, but the knee is part of our leg that helps us bend it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eyes, nose, and mouth are all found on our face. The knee is the odd one out because it is on our leg, not on our face. Children sometimes mix up where body parts are, but the knee is always on the leg.

questions.question_text: Which of these does NOT help keep our body clean?
questions.explanation_correct: Eating sweets does NOT help keep our body clean. Taking a bath, brushing teeth, and washing hands are all good habits that keep us clean and healthy. Eating sweets can actually cause germs on our teeth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taking a bath, brushing teeth, and washing hands are all things we do to stay clean. Eating sweets is not a cleaning habit. Too many sweets can make our teeth dirty and unhealthy.

questions.question_text: Why should we take a bath every day?

options.text: To remove dirt and germs from our body

questions.explanation_correct: We take a bath every day to remove dirt and germs from our body. Bathing keeps our skin clean and healthy. If we do not bathe, germs can stay on our skin and make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not take a bath just to play with water or because water is fun. We also do not bathe to make our clothes wet. The real reason is to wash away dirt and germs so our body stays clean and healthy.

questions.question_text: Why should we wash our hands before eating?

options.text: To make our hands look pretty
To wash away germs so we do not get sick
To make the food taste better

questions.explanation_correct: We wash our hands before eating to remove germs and dirt. Our hands touch many things during the day and can pick up germs. If we eat with dirty hands, the germs can go into our body and make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not wash hands just to look pretty or because the teacher said so. Washing hands does not change how food tastes. The real reason is to remove germs so they do not enter our body when we eat.

questions.question_text: Why do we need the sense of hearing?

options.text: To listen to sounds and understand what people say

questions.explanation_correct: We need the sense of hearing so we can listen to sounds around us and understand what people say. Our ears help us hear our teacher in school, hear music, and know when someone is calling us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not need hearing to see friends, taste food, or smell flowers. Those need sight, taste, and smell. We need hearing so our ears can pick up sounds, like people talking, birds singing, and bells ringing.
